,http://www.igniterealtime.org/projects/openfire,Blocker,Fixed,dwd,wroot,wroot,8/5/2016 20:24,12/21/2016 21:19,3/21/2020 16:11,8/12/2016 19:21,4.1.0,,,,4.1.0,,Admin Console,,,1,admin,admin_console,,,When going through setup process of a current build, on the admin account page the Current password field is shown, although this is a fresh installation and there shouldn't be any old password (default password ""admin"" shouldn't make this field showing and 'admin' doesn't work of course).",,,,OF-1156,OF-1253,No,,,,,0|i013un:,No,"08/06/16 09:28 AM;wroot;If i do fresh install of 4.0.2 first and complete the setup and then install latest alpha code on top, it shows me either CSRF Failure error when trying to login or
java.lang.NullPointerException: Null value is not allowed!

,08/12/16 07:21 PM;guus;This problem is introduced by the first solution to OF-1156. By reverting that change, this problem disappears.","08/12/16 07:25 PM;akrherz;I am fairly certain this issue does not exist on clean 4.0.3 alpha, so I removed that version from being affected",,,,,,,,,,,

Is there any schedule to fix it? Seem like it appears frequently.,"09/18/17 03:53 PM;dgwave;This issue showed up in the following situation:
Windows Clustered pair at 4.1.5 with a shared database on a MySQL server running on CentOS 7

Both nodes up and Synced.  Rebooted one node.  Came back up appearing fine. Rebooted 2nd node 30 minutes later.  Now I'm getting this NPE error and the following behavior: Users are unable to rejoin the rooms they were in when the 2nd node rebooted.  Server sees ghost user entries (has 27 users in room, only 20 listed), but its pair does not see those users.  Connecting to either server does not resolve the issue.",05/14/18 11:53 AM;deaneoati;Is this ever going to get fixed? I see that it gets bumped every release and there is no activity. We are experiencing the same issue in a 4 system cluster.,,,,,,,,,
